lines.text: My one chance to get raped, and you can't get your bloody trousers off.

[Steve has just asked Vickie to lunch]
Oh, what the hell. A girl has to eat.
I'm beginning to sound like a wife.
I suppose your husband likes to sleep late on Sundays?
Yes, he does.
I suppose you like to go home and cook him a nice big breakfast?
No.
Don't you like to cook?
Oh, I love to cook.
Doesn't he like to eat?
He loves to eat.
I, I don't understand.
We have different kitchens, his is in Milan.
It's a shame!
Please don't cry, he found another cook.
Don't cross-examine me in the rain. I'll be there. Wet. But I'll be there.
I'm sorry to bother you at this late hour, but do you have oregano?
Christ, I hope not! I had a checkup last week.
Taxi!
Oh!
Would you care to share it?
Are you married?
Yeah.
You take it.
Maybe you and Mr. Allessio would have dinner with me and my husband some night.
Well, that's very kind of you, but I'm afraid I'm right out of Mr. Allessios.
God, you're all the same. This obsession with male sexual prowess. It is so typically American.
Oh, is it?
It is, if you don't mind me telling you.
I don't mind you telling me, not a bit. But it's just that phrase I can't stand - "typically American".
Why not?
Because there's no such thing as typically American.
Whoa-ho-ho!

It's a big place, America. Which typically American Americans do you mean? The cab drivers in New York? The coal miners in Pennsylvania? The students at Berkeley? The Mormons in Utah? The Harlem Globetrotters? How about the Daughters of the American Revolution? Are those the ones you mean? I'll tell you something. They're all throwing rocks at each other. The only thing typically American about the two hundred million Americans is that they never do anything typically alike, and that goes for humping too.
